item.title: Sampling Methods
item.description: 1. Inverse of CDF Inverse transform sampling is a method for generating random numbers from any probability distribution by using its inverse cumulative distribution \(F^{-1}(x)\). Recall that the cumulative distribution for a random variable X is \(F_{X}(x)=P(X \leq x)\). A random variable \(U\) uniformly distributed on \([0,1]\). Step 1. Generate \(U \sim Unif(0,1)\). Step 2. Let \(X = F^{-1}_{X}(U)\). This method works when inverting \(F_{X}\) is easy if \(X\) is an exponential random variable, but its harder if \(X\) is a Normal random variable.
